False Claim Calling PM Narendra Modi A "Dangerous Patriot" Attributed To New York Times

An article calling India's PM Narendra Modi a "dangerous patriot" has been attributed to Joseph Hope, alleged Editor-in-Chief of the New York Times.

The claim reads: "Joseph Hope, Editor-in-Chief of the New York Times: Narendra Modi's sole aim is to make India a better Country… If he is not stopped, in the future… India will become the most Powerful Nation in the World… It will surprise even the USA, the United Kingdom, and Russia..Japan. Narendra Modi is moving towards a specific goal.. No one knows what he wants to do..and his intentions strategy cannot be predicted. Behind the Smiling face, he is a dangerous Patriot.. He uses all the Countries of the world for the benefit of his Nation… India.."

The claim further states: "With the current astounding growth of India, all the Countries in the United Nations will experience the consequences..! Oh, man! I couldn't even pay someone to write such compliments! Great article, tells u what NO media in India will speak about the achievement of Modi and his foreign policy."

Fact Check/Verification:

We first searched the New York Times (NYT) website for the alleged article but found no such article or opinion piece published by them. We also could not find anyone named "Joseph Hope" in the "Our People" section of the NYT website.

The NYT website lists Dean Baquet as its Executive Editor.

Earlier this year, the official NYT Communications handle tweeted that the claim calling India's PM Narendra Modi a "dangerous patriot" is false. Their tweet stated, "A false claim circulating in India related to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and The New York Times has been fact-checked; it is not true."

A NYT spokesperson clarified that the editor of The New York Times is Dean Baquet and he has not said or written the attached message. They also confirmed that no one named Joseph Hope works for The New York Times.

Conclusion:

Our research makes it clear that the claim calling PM Narendra Modi a "dangerous patriot," and attributed to Joseph Hope, alleged Editor-in-Chief of the New York Times is false. There's no one named "Joseph Hope" on the NYT team.

Result: False
title: Fact: The claim calling PM Narendra Modi a “dangerous patriot,” and attributed to Joseph Hope, alleged Editor-in-Chief of the New York Times is false. There’s no one named “Joseph Hope” on the NYT team and it has been debunked by NYT.
vclaim: A viral message falsely claims that New York Times Editor-in-Chief Joseph Hope wrote an article calling PM Narendra Modi a "dangerous patriot" who aims to make India the world's most powerful nation. The New York Times has officially denied publishing any such article and confirmed that no one named Joseph Hope works for their organization.
